channel.title: The Kitchen Sink
channel.description:
Because your FM radio stations suck. Putting some fun, some effort, back into the aural experience.
So if you're sick of what you hear going up and down the dial, stop by and have a listen.
Rock, Soul, Blues, Country, Rockabilly, Local & Indie, Punk, Hip-Hop, Movie Audio Clips and much, much more.
The best mix, and easily the most diverse mix, of music you will hear ANYWHERE!!!
ADDITIONAL EPISODES can be found at www.thekitchensink.mypodcast.com.
After you've listened to an episode(or two), PLEASE LEAVE A COMMENT and then click on the SUBSCRIBE WITH iTUNES botton to add.
Lastly, please let us know PROMPTLY if you encounter ANY issues either downloading or listening to our episodes!!!
Christopher @ The Kitchen Sink
channel.itunes:subtitle: Music for those who like it ALL!!

item.title: That 70's Podcast
item.description: 101 minutes of music and clips from the 70's. Disco, punk, soul, rock, pop, funk, and country are all represented in abundance. This latest episode features (highlights) the diversity of music that made the 70's great. From Devo to Waylon Jennings, from Marvin Gaye to Marvin Hamlisch, this episode is truly music for those who like it all. And for those of you enjoy who a good read, may I suggest The Brueck Equation by Simmons Norwood (www.simmonsnorwood.com)
item.dc:creator: The Kitchen Sink
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: POWER TO THE PEOPLE: A CELEBRATION OF LABOR
item.description: As Labor Day approaches and the American worker finds herself/himself seemingly under constant seige, could there be a better time to comment on worker struggles with music? From the Tea Party (THE CLASH & THE REVEREND HORTON HEAT) to corporate America (SPINAL TAP & FLYGUY) to the Progressive Left (RACHEL MADDOW & KEITH OLBERMANN), all points of view have influence in this 100 minute episode, but in the end it's all about the encouraging, promoting and celebrating of all those hard working women and men out there. Special thanks to the WOMEN OF SDRD, KaRi @ The Prime Spot and Roller Derby / Accounting extraordinaire, Lace E. Underpants! SDRD http://sandiegorollerderby.com/ LACY ITALIANO http://onthegotaxandnotary.com/ LBRD http://longbeachrollerderby.com/ Check out our links and events page on Podomatic. Search for The Kitchen Sink Podcast Group on FB. ROCKOUT ALS - BATON ROUGE http://www.facebook.com/rockoutals.batonrouge ROCKOUT ALS - ST. LOUIS http://www.facebook.com/rockoutals.saintlouis

item.title: STFU (IT'S INSTRUMENTAL)
item.description: To quote the tagline from Jaws 2, "Just When You Thought It Was Safe". Some six months after the last episode, The Kitchen Sink has returned with its BIGGEST EPISODE TO DATE. You've heard them scattered throughout other episodes, now here's an episode dedicated solely to having nothing to say. So in keeping with the theme, everything is being kept to a minimum, EXCEPT the music...and SoCal derby info. Southern California and TKS faves, UNPOPABLE (aka, Balloon Bass), reside inside. You can find them online at www.balloonbass.com or on Facebook at http://facebook.com/addi.somekh. Saturday, August 20th, at Skateworld in San Diego, San Diego Roller Derby host the Hidden City Heebie Jeebies AND "The Gals" of Long Beach Roller Derby. FB 'em for info or check out my Events page for more details. Thank you for your patience, even if you're not a doctor.

Southern California and TKS faves, UNPOPABLE (aka, Balloon Bass), reside inside. You can find them online at www.balloonbass.com or on Facebook at http://facebook.com/addi.somekh.
Saturday, August 20th, at Skateworld in San Diego, San Diego Roller Derby host the Hidden City Heebie Jeebies AND "The Gals" of Long Beach Roller Derby. FB 'em for info or check out my Events page for more details.
Thank you for your patience, even if you're not a doctor.

item.title: LOVE, CALIFORNIA
item.description: An episode in celebration of The Golden State, California. Musical genres ranging from '60s surf guitar, '80s punk and all the way through to the local/"indie" music scene of the new century, ranging in styles from pop to punk and mild to wild, if it's even remotely associated with the California music scene, you're bound to find it here. Check out the events page for yet even more roller derby info from San Diego & Long Beach. I've also added more links to some of my favorite local bands like Temper Tantrum, Unpopable, Willie Cash & The Cashiers, Desperation Squad and The Abe Lincoln Story. So break out your quads, boogie boards and volleyballs because this is an episode guaranteed to get you in a California state of mind. Special thanks to LBRD's EMME SIXTEEN for the episode flyer!! Up next? The Kitchen Sink's 5TH ANNIVERSARY episode. Stay tuned...

item.title: A QUESTION OF FAITH
item.description: With the holidays right around the corner, what better time to ask, what do you believe? 92+ minutes of religious-themed music and clips designed to infuriate, question and celebrate. Featuring the likes of Jackie On Acid, The Ramones, George Carlin, Jerry Falwell, Robert Plant, Dennis Miller, Moodswings, The Call, Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, Chrissie Hynde & Martin Luther King If this episode doesn't get you into heaven...you're probably on your way to hell. For the best looking toes in SoCal, check out NAIL TIPS in Orange. http://www.yelp.com/biz/nail-tips-orange Moxi Rollerskates http://www.yelp.com/biz/moxi-roller-skates-long-beach An FYI, Honky Tonk Christmas is taking place December 18th at The Cellar (http://thecellarlbc.ning.com/) in Long Beach, CA. Richard Cheese www.richardcheese.com

item.title: WILLIE CASH LIVE!!
item.description: ANOTHER CLASSIC FROM THE ARN SERIES: Mr. Willie Cash joins me in-studio for a chat, for a sit down and to play some acoustic songs from his WEST COAST COUNTRY cd. I want you to check him out online at, www.williecash.com and www.myspace.com/williecash. Purchase his music, check out his friends but above all...SUPPORT YOUR LOCAL MUSIC SCENE! www.eloquentbooks.com/trailsandtribulations.html
